title: Review: Antony & The Johnsons – Thank You For Your Love EP
body:
![](http://c4.ac-images.myspacecdn.com/images02/105/l_756ce052626d4706a2d8aa7ed6abc5af.jpg "Antony & the Johnsons")

After the critical success of last years third studio album _The Crying Light_, **Antony & The Johnsons** are back with a new EP entitled _Thank You For Your Love_. Acting as a tantalising taster of the upcoming album _Swanlights_, this collection of tracks bodes very well for the future release. Just like last years release, **Antony’s** voice is as angelic and uplifting as ever, with title track _Thank You For You Love_ being a simple yet stunning piano led composition, building to an all out trumpet blaring epic anthem. **Antony** also takes on the task of covering songs by two of the greats, _Imagine_ by **John Lennon** and _Pressing On_ by **Bob Dylan** respectively. Pressing On is fairly non-distinct, however _Imagine_ is an ambitious and alluring version of what is widely regarded as one of the greatest songs of all time. Taking the song into a first person perspective, **Antony’s** voice controls each word delicately, caressing and elegantly massaging every syllable. Not since **John Lennon** has it sounded so chillingly appropriate for a singer to morosely yearn “_they say I’m a dreamer, but I’m not the only one_“.

[Check Out Antony & The Johnson’s Myspace!](http://www.myspace.com/antonyandthejohnsons/)
